intro: Gardenia weissichii, commonly known as the Weissich gardenia, is a species native to southern China. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers bloom in summer and are known for their strong, sweet scent, making it a popular ornamental plant. Gardenia weissichii prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, thriving in humid climates.
